item.title: Heavy leaefs, 21st October
item.description:
Dear Brent Council, I would like to report that the pavement along Willesden Lane, from Marlow Court to the corner of Sidmouth Road, has been extremely slippery for the past two weeks. No cleaning or maintenance has been done during this time. The surface is very dangerous for pedestrians — especially older people and children — and someone could easily fall or get injured. Please could you arrange for the area to be cleaned and made safe as soon as possible?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Willesden Lane, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unclear road signage - road closure Webber street leading onto blackfriars, 21st October
item.description:
There is no diversion sign allowing right turns despite the road leading onto Blackfriars road being closed on 21/10. This forced me to make a right turn despite this being against the signage, leading to a potential PCN.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Valentine Place, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Highway obstruction again at no 8, 21st October
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clapton Terrace, Hackney, London

item.category: Street cleaning - Blue bags left on street

item.title: Vastly overgrown weeds / shrubs obstructing pavement, 21st October
item.description:
Reported to Peabody via FMS but Greenwich Land Pavement width reduced by over 50%, due to these unkept for ages weeds and shrubs. Needs to be properly cut back WELL CLEAR of publc pavement, as at present people have to walk in the road to pass each other which is extremely dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meadowford Close, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
